item.title: Whonix 11
item.dc:creator: Hiberts
item.description:
Whonix is Whonix, Tails is Tails .
Whonix save data on the disk if you want, Tails not if you want .
Try to understand this .
With Whonix you can choose to save data or not thanks to Virtualbox for example, Tails let save the data with persistence feature but it’s a different thing, definetely Whonix is better .

However i advise you do not install Whonix to SD, it will be too slow . Use a USB 3.0 external HDD, make a FDE ( Full DIsk Encryption ), install Whonix in other hidden partition and enjoy .
If you don’t want to save data in your Whonix, search anonguide to Google and read all chapters .
They will explain how to make a “live” Whonix, better than a normal distro live conception .

item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix uses a different approach. Whonix never was amnesic. Never claimed to be. Documents it’s not. It might get an amnesic feature some time in future. While this is a huge disadvantage, it allows doing a lot other stuff. If the amnesic feature is most important to you, then Whonix isn’t the right tool for you.

item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
[quote=“ZZZ, post:13, topic:1405”]I have a important question. How to do it. I have a public and private key generated in the program
KGpg. He would like every time what I closed the Whonix Workstation and Gateway and save to pendrive or SD card, To files are not left on your hard drive. How to do so.[/quote]
Preventing write to the local hdd is not (yet) possible. Whonix is not amnesic:

Whonix

Warning

Things you should know about Whonix and Anonymity in General to stay safe.

You might consider Using Whonix on External Media:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Pre_Install_Advice#Using_Whonix_on_External_Media

As per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/About#Based_on_Debian. First step would be making the USB device accessible in Whonix. The use gpg/kgpg settings to change the data patch. Or use other trickery. Such as symlinks. This is non-trivial stuff. I can only provide theoretical suggestions. Untested, but very likely to work since I am doing similar stuff. I will personally not be writing step by step instructions for such tasks because time is too limited. Sorry, things are not super intuitive simple yet.
